data.text:
I am happy to announce that our recently accepted paper was published by IEEE Geoscience and Remote Sensing Letters. It is the result of efforts made by me, Hugo Oliveira, and Jefersson Alex dos Santos, with the support of Pattern Recognition and Earth Observation Laboratory,¬†Departamento de Ci√™ncia da Computa√ß√£o - UFMG and University of Stirling.

 In this journal, we investigated the benefits of applying self-supervised techniques to enhance semantic segmentation in seismic images. Access via: https://lnkd.in/gX_DrGhk 

Briefly explained, the idea is to support the interpretation of lithostratigraphic facies in a preliminary stage of understanding a seismic volume. As deep learning techniques typically rely on numerous labeled samples for training, we explore the improvement provided by applying a pretext task in the same data domain before the main task of semantic segmentation. To simulate a few-shot scenario, we used¬†1, 5, 10, and 20 labeled images during fine-tuning and verified that pre-training within the data domain provided great enhancement to the final goal. 

Code available at: https://lnkd.in/gwr9JuQZ
